<@U02546A8D2B> I could see agencies shifting away from Web2 work stacks to Web3/blockchain-enabled/smart contracts coming into the mix. I'd imagine the most boiled down use cases to be like these three: 

1. Create/use a blockchain payment portal for services rendered
• Less in tx fees over traditional 2.9% when paying by card
• Receive funds near-instant instead of 2-3 days processing
• 1:1 transfer of deliverables < to > payment per smart contract (ex. No deliverables or release of IP until payment is initiated)
2. Web3 clients and agencies can work out an incentive-based contract
• X service(s) gets paid out each month or upon delivery in Y amount of client tokens (or other crypto assets with little/no mint cost)
• If NFT/smart contracts are involved, % royalties are paid in perpetuity each time an NFT is sold on secondary markets to both agency and the client
3. Internal operations, build your own DAO to pay W-9/contractors via tokens e.g., <https://www.usebraintrust.com/|BrainTrust> or <https://www.blackfreelancer.com/|BlackFreelancer>.
• Everyone leverages contractors. Even on my own, I subcontract work
• Also increases contractor loyalty, talent network, and token value over time 
4. Bonus: Offer a grant or fund to split among select participants to build any Web3 application (dApp) that supports the service-based industry.

The best talent in the world is getting vacuumed up in Web3, might as well be the one to fund their ideas ;D

Closing thought
The above are skeuomorphic (naturally), but I believe those that adopt Web3 now will be the ones to innovate their own spaces in the future.
